messages.subject: Re: harmed by school (was add)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/31/2002 1:58:32 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... My 17 yo went to school through 4th grade. SHE says that she will probably spend the rest of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/31/2002 1:58:32 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Some would just say "personality differences", and while I can't discount
> that, it doesn't explain away all of it.

My 17 yo went to school through 4th grade. SHE says that she will probably
spend the rest of her life getting over it. And, I should mention that she
had NO problems in school and was a superstar student and very liked by
teachers and other kids alike. There are lessons learned there - lessons that
are REALLY learned and when something is REALLY learned it is hard, very very
hard, to unlearn it. (Read Frank Smith - The Book of Learning and Forgetting)

--pamS


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
